channel.title: To skip, or not to skip?
channel.description: Outside, there is currently 3ft of snow in my front yard, even more in the back. The roads have had salt dropped on them all night, now we have about an inch of ice on 3 of the major road around here. We got a 2 hour delay(wtf?), even though News Channels are complaining it is too dangerous to be out and we should all stay inside. People who are getting home from work are driving 10~15mph on a major highway. I swear, sometimes my school is retarded.

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“ninja nub, post:10, topic:173475”][quote author=pko link=topic=233787.msg1999122#msg1999122 date=1200460513]
the only reason Florida sucks
[/quote]

I wish it snowed again in Florida. (like 1 cm in 1979 lol)[/quote]
Snowed over Holiday Break.

Read full topic

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

I wish it was like that for us, the main issue here is that the little bridge the public transport goes over to get to the college is almost flooded, but apparently it will be better tomorrow…Why can’t we ever get fucking 3ft of snow ?

Read full topic
item.source: To skip, or not to skip?

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @Sick_of_Air Sick of Air
item.description:
@Sick_of_Air wrote:

My school did that once, except it was only about half a foot of snow, but still an inch of ice on the roads. We had a 2 hour delay. When we went, we almost rear-ended someone trying to stop so I could get out. My dad told me to jump out because he was just going to keep going. Many people fell that day, but none of them got more than a few bruises.

Read full topic
item.source: To skip, or not to skip?

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Don’t go, your safety is more important than a day of school.
My school is like that too, one time the heaters were broken and it was actually -5 degrees on the first floor. Some people just left [I could have just walked home but I stayed].

Read full topic
item.source: To skip, or not to skip?

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @swordskid61 Swordskid61
item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

Call in sick.

exe626:

Outside, there is currently 3ft of snow in my front yard, even more in the back. The roads have had salt dropped on them all night, now we have about an inch of ice on 3 of the major road around here. We got a 2 hour delay(wtf?), even though News Channels are complaining it is too dangerous to be out and we should all stay inside. People who are getting home from work are driving 10~15mph on a major highway. I swear, sometimes my school is retarded.

I’d be happy to get a 2-hour delay at all, our school board is shit. they wouldn’t give us a day off if the roads were a big ol’ iceburg.

Read full topic
item.source: To skip, or not to skip?

item.title: To skip, or not to skip?
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:2, topic:173475”]Skip. Or, go… find a path at your school slip, break something and sue them.[/quote] Get rich bitch. Just don’t let em you found out from here or that ya did it on purpose ^^. Oh and I never did know you could sew schools :p.

Read full topic
